page.title: 19Sheerness Canal
page.content: The{canal,}stretching from Barton's Point to Queensway, was originally built for defence during the Napoleonic War. Today it is a neglected area which has become polluted with domestic waste. On the banks the pollutants include old tyres, milk crates, plastic bottles and crisp packets. In the canal itself there are old prams, mattresses, tyres and a profusion of plastic bags and containers. As a result of tests with Universal Indicator paper the water was found to be PH 10 which shows a high level of{pollution. The result on the{ecology}has been growth of weeds and little variety of{insect life.}The stagnant water is, however, a breeding ground for gnats.
